Class BST<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cp213.BST<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AVL, PopularityTree

    public class BST<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a Binary Search Tree.

    2021-07-05
    Author:
    your name here, David Brown

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(CountedValue<T> key)
        Determines if this BST contains key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to search for.
        Returns:
        true if this BST contains key, false otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(BST<T> target)
        Determines whether two BSTs are identical.
        Parameters:
        target - The BST to compare this BST against.
        Returns:
        true if this BST and that BST contain nodes that match in position, value, count, and height, false otherwise.

      • getComparisons

        public int getComparisons()
        Get number of comparisons executed by the retrieve method.
        Returns:
        comparisons

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the root node of this BST.
        Returns:
        height of root node, 0 if the root node is null.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of nodes in the BST.
        Returns:
        number of node in this BST.

      • inOrder

        public java.util.ArrayList<CountedValue<T>> inOrder()
        Returns an array of copies of CountedValue objects in a linked data structure. The array contents are in data order from smallest to largest. Not thread safe as it assumes contents of data structure are not changed by an external thread during the copy loop. If data elements are added or removed by an external thread while the data is being copied to the array, then the declared array size may no longer be valid.
        Returns:
        this tree data as an array of data.

      • insert

        public void insert(CountedValue<T> data)
        Inserts data into this BST.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to store.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determines if this BST is empty.
        Returns:
        true if this BST is empty, false otherwise.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Determines if this BST is a valid BST; i.e. a node's left child data is smaller than its data, and its right child data is greater than its data, and a node's height is equal to the maximum of the heights of its two children (empty child nodes have a height of 0), plus 1.
        Returns:
        true if this BST is a valid BST, false otherwise.

      • levelOrder

        public java.util.ArrayList<CountedValue<T>> levelOrder()
        Returns an array of copies of CountedValue objects int a linked data structure. The array contents are in level order starting from the root (this) node. Helps determine the structure of the tree. Not thread safe as it assumes contents of data structure are not changed by an external thread during the copy loop. If data elements are added or removed by an external thread while the data is being copied to the array, then the declared array size may no longer be valid.
        Returns:
        this tree values as an array of values.

      • resetComparisons

        public void resetComparisons()
        Resets the comparison count to 0.

      • retrieve

        public CountedValue<T> retrieve(CountedValue<T> key)
        Retrieves a copy of value matching key (key should have value count of 0). Returning a complete CountedValue gives access to the value and count.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look for.
        Returns:
        data The complete CountedValue that matches key, null otherwise.
